title: isay weinfeld designs interiors for ‘the green spot’ restaurant in barcelona
text:
isay weinfeld designs interiors for 'the green spot' restaurant in barcelona feb 05, 2017 isay weinfeld designs interiors for 'the green spot' restaurant in barcelona 

in barcelona, brazilian architect isay weinfeld has designed the interiors of a vegetarian eatery for renowned restaurateur tomás tarruella. located in the catalan capital’s barceloneta neighborhood, the scheme is defined by its bold, yet restrained use of materials, with rich timber tones contrasting its whitewashed walls and dense areas of greenery. 


upon entering ‘the green spot’ , guests move through a long hall lined with oak paneling, and past an atrium filled with plants and other vegetation. the restaurant’s main room is an open and welcoming space, filled with wooden dining tables and low-slung couches. the interior scheme exemplifies isay weinfeld’s keen attention to detail, with the carefully selected pieces of furniture presented in harmony with the building’s architecture. 
the kitchen features a cast concrete island unit 


the bar, which serves drinks until 2am on saturdays and sundays, hosts live music performances on tuesdays and thursdays. the restaurant is owned by en compañía de lobos , the personal project of entrepreneur tomás tarruella . the company — who owns a number of eateries across barcelona, as well as further afield — seeks to create unique restaurants, each with their own personality.
